text: Just saw a LinkedIn Influencer with 'Organic Growth' written in the profile with 65K+ followers claiming that he can help you in growing your platform, copying the posts from other influencers.
name: Codebasics

text:
Jobseekers, this one's for you.
 Every application, every interview, every follow-up… the pressure is immense.
 And I know what you're thinking: Am I not good enough? 
 But let me tell you, this isn't about you or your skills. It's about a broken system where 60% of applicants never hear back. 
 Your mental health is not worth sacrificing for a system that doesn't acknowledge your worth. 
 Please remember, taking care of yourself is the real priority. 
 Your dream job will come, but for now, breathe.
name: Codebasics

text: Looking for jobs on LinkedIn is like online dating: Full of promises, but in the end, you're just left ghosted.
name: Codebasics

text:
LinkedIn scams be like: 'Congratulations, you've been selected for a role you didn't even apply for!' 
 The catch? Pay Rs. 50,000 for the honor.
name: Codebasics

text:
sapne dekhna achi baat hai,
lekin job ka sapna dekh ke 'interested' likhna,
yeh toh achi baat nahi hai na?
name: Codebasics

text:
Next time when I'll be reading some LinkedIn Influencer's story, I am starting from the last line.
If there's a link attached to it, it's most probably a fake one.
Saves me time!
name: Codebasics

text:
Every time I poured my heart into 5-6 rounds of interviews and faced rejection, it felt like a punch in the gut. The sleepless nights, the endless preparation, all for nothing.

But looking back, I realize it wasn't nothing. It was the Universe's way of saying, “Not this one, something better is on the way.”

Every single time, I've been shown why that rejection happened.

Doors I thought I wanted to walk through were shut, only to have the right ones swing open.

The kind that aligned with my growth, my values, and my happiness.

At first, it stung. It hurt deeply. But now, when things don't go as planned, I don't panic.

I don't question my worth. I sit back, breathe, and trust. The Universe knows.

I know there's another plan waiting. Something bigger, better, and just for me.

To anyone feeling the weight of rejection: trust that the closed doors are protecting you from something you can't see right now.

Your path is being cleared for something even more beautiful.
name: Codebasics

text:
To everyone who's still looking for a job...

I see you. I feel you. 
Every rejection email feels like a punch in the gut, and every 'We'll get back to you' sounds more like 'You'll never hear from us.'

But I want you to know, you're not alone in this. 
According to a study, 80% of jobseekers struggle with anxiety and self-doubt during their search. It's normal to feel lost, but it's not the end.

Take breaks, breathe, and remember, this doesn't define you. Your worth is not tied to an offer letter.
Your mental health matters more than any job.
name: Codebasics

text:
Sometimes, we forget that a company’s brand name doesn’t define someone’s talent. It's easy to get caught up in the 'big company = big talent' mindset, but that's not always the case.

I’ve had the privilege of working with people from smaller companies (lesser known) who blow me away with their skills and dedication. They don’t need a fancy title or a famous brand behind them to prove their worth.

I've seen the other side too—people in top-tier companies feeling lost, overwhelmed, or stuck, even though the world sees them as 'successful'.

Let’s stop attaching someone’s value to the company they work for. Freshers especially need to hear this—skills are what matter, not the size of the company behind them.

At the end of the day, happiness and growth don’t come from a brand name, they come from doing what you love and constantly improving your craft.
name: Codebasics

text:
So when I left a toxic work environment, I told my manager a simple thing and felt so good 
I just said-

'Hope your son gets a manager like you.
I hope that the manager behaves the same way as you did with me.
Thank you.'

Now tell me 1 thing-

She always said that she was a great manager.
Why will she get offended?

I just told her that I wish her son would get a manager like she was.

If you felt bad, then that means you were a bad manager and now you know it. 
If you feel good, then take it as a blessing for your son and you'll really want someone to treat your son/daughter in the same way.

She cannot be even angry with me else it'll prove that she was not a 'great' manager.

Muskan - 1
Manager - 0

Muskan -> Aura +100000000

(Fictional message unfortunately :(
)

Hope you all become the people that your sons/daughters will like to work under 🙏

There are a lot of bad people/things, bring a small change and break the chain :)
name: Codebasics

text: Probably one of the longest interviews I've ever done, but I really enjoyed my wide-ranging conversation with Lex Fridman and going deep on so many areas of technology progress. Plus Lex tries out our new XR glasses and Google Beam!
name: Sundar Pichai

text: Great to see Alphabet / Google at the top of this list. I've always thought the best 'perk' of the company is my fellow Googlers - brilliant, innovative, and entirely focused on making helpful things for our users and customers. Just a few weeks shy of my 21st (!) Googleversary and still feeling lucky.
name: Sundar Pichai

text:
It’s not every day we have a launch that actually involves a rocket.  After a successful flight over the weekend, the first FireSat satellite is now in orbit! 🛰️ It’s the first of about 50 that we’re launching over the coming few years to help track and detect wildfires, using AI. 

FireSat was designed to give us better tools to track and detect fires. Using advanced sensors and high resolution, it can detect a fire as small as 5x5 meters, which wasn't possible before. It updates every 20 minutes, comparing fresh imagery against historical data and factoring in local conditions like infrastructure and weather. Then it beams updates to emergency teams on the ground so they can react in real time. 

FireSat builds on our work using AI to map the boundaries of large wildfires and get people accurate information in 27 countries (including during the LA fires earlier this year.) In the next few weeks we’ll start testing, and the system will be fully operational over the next few years.

This is a huge effort with many partners including Muon Space, Earth Fire Alliance, and the Gordon and Betty Moore Foundation.
name: Sundar Pichai

text: Earlier this week, I had a great conversation with Doug McMillon during a visit with Walmart's global technology team. We covered everything from the potential of generative AI and how Walmart is using our Gemini models to improve discoverability on their site... to the partnership with Wing and Walmart to pilot drone deliveries… to my new Walmart+ subscription:) Walmart is an iconic global company, and I enjoyed my visit there. Thanks to the team for having me!
name: Sundar Pichai

text:
For my first-ever LinkedIn post, I thought I’d share a sneak peek of the Shoreline Amphitheatre stage, as we put some finishing touches on our keynote for Google I/O tomorrow. Can’t wait to see those seats filled with developers from around the world who are building the next generation of AI experiences.

Excited to join Demis Hassabis Elizabeth Reid Sissie H. James Manyika
and others on stage. We'll share how our Gemini models are bringing breakthrough AI capabilities to people through our products, as well as innovation across safety, research, infrastructure…we’re going to talk about it all. Tune in if you can — 10 a.m. PT tomorrow! https://io.google
name: Sundar Pichai

text:
It was great to sit down with David Friedberg from the All-In team for a wide-ranging conversation. Fun to reminisce and look ahead… from how we see a big opportunity with Search, the investments we’re making in our world-class infrastructure and TPUs, and how we’re leaning into these moments of massive innovation.

Thanks again to David for the time. Link in the comments.
name: Sundar Pichai

text:
It’s been a strong start to 2025 — and we’re only just getting started 
Across Google and Alphabet, Q1 saw great momentum in our products, our platforms, and the impact we’re having around the world.

A few highlights:

 Gemini 2.5, our most intelligent model yet, is leading the industry and sets a strong foundation for our future innovation.
 AI Overviews in Search are now used by over 1.5 billion people each month, and we’re excited about the early reaction to AI Mode in Search, lots more to come.
 Subscriptions surpassed 270 million, led by YouTube and Google One.
 Gemini is now available in all 15 Google products that have over half a billion users — and it’s redefining what AI-first smartphones can do, including our latest Pixel 9a.
 At Google Cloud Next, we launched Ironwood, our most powerful TPU to date, and became the first to offer NVIDIA’s next-gen Blackwell GPUs. We’re also rolling out new tools for building and orchestrating multi-agent AI systems.
 YouTube celebrated its 20th birthday — still #1 in U.S. streaming on TVs, and now with 125M+ Music & Premium subscribers and over a billion podcast users.
Waymo is now serving 250,000+ paid rides a week, and started operation in Silicon Valley. Miami and DC coming next year!

This work is only possible thanks to the incredible teams across Alphabet — thank you. With I/O, Brandcast, and Google Marketing Live just around the corner — there’s so much more to come in Q2!
name: Sundar Pichai

text: Yesterday I was in Pittsburgh, which is a really special place for me - one of the first cities I visited in the US and where we announced our Grow with Google economic opportunity initiative in 2017. I spent the day with the next generation of technologists, from high schoolers who are starting to explore STEM, to college students embarking on their computer science and technology careers.
name: Sundar Pichai

text:
I am delighted to nominate Jared Isaacman, an accomplished business leader, philanthropist, pilot, and astronaut, as Administrator of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA). Jared will drive NASA’s mission of discovery and inspiration, paving the way for groundbreaking achievements in Space science, technology, and exploration.

Over the past 25 years, as the Founder and CEO of Shift4, Jared has demonstrated exceptional leadership, building a trailblazing global financial technology company. He also co-founded and served as CEO of Draken International, a defense aerospace company, for over a decade, supporting the U.S. Department of Defense, and our Allies.

Jared’s passion for Space, astronaut experience, and dedication to pushing the boundaries of exploration, unlocking the mysteries of the universe, and advancing the new Space economy, make him ideally suited to lead NASA into a bold new Era.

Congratulations to Jared, his wife Monica, and their children, Mila and Liv!
